bill_title: require employers that employ certain foreign workers to pay a certain wage.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require employers that employ certain foreign workers to pay a certain wage. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any employer who has a foreign labor certification to employ a foreign worker in a temporary nonagricultural or temporary agricultural occupation for a period of less than one year shall pay that foreign worker at least one hundred fifty percent of the prevailing wage, as determined by the Department of Labor, for the occupation in which the foreign worker is employed. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
